conclusion: There are four objects: a mushroom (A), a statue-like object (B), a dress-like object (C), and a book (D).
The shadows cast by these objects are labeled A, B, C, and D.
The light source moves forward (closer to the objects and above them).
Shadows will shift in the opposite direction of the light source's movement, moving backward.
If the light source gets closer to the objects, the shadows will become smaller.
If the light source moves farther away, the shadows will become larger.
Shadow A (mushroom) will move backward and become smaller as the light source moves closer.
Shadow B (statue-like object) will move backward and become smaller as the light source moves closer.
Shadow C (dress-like object) will move backward and become smaller as the light source moves closer.
Shadow D (book) will move backward and become smaller as the light source moves closer.
All shadows (A, B, C, and D) will move backward and become smaller as the light source moves closer.
